blog.name: pardonmymannerssir
blog.title: Pardon My Manners
blog.description: Fic writer by day, procrastinator by night.

summary: Everything I hold dear (resides in those eyes)
title: Everything I hold dear (resides in those eyes)
body:
Jon/Sansa one -shot. Read the entire thing on AO3 here.

Rating: Mature

Warnings: Some mentions of past rape.

Summary: Daenerys Targaryen will give up her throne for no man, not even one she loves, and so Jon Snow marries Sansa Stark and the world reshapes itself.

Sansa can tell by his breathing that he is still awake, they have not been abed long, and she bites her lip for a moment, summoning a bit of courage before reaching out and brushing a finger along one pinkish line that starts at the tip of a shoulder blade and dips down toward the other. He tenses beneath her touch but does not turn or move away.

“This one,” she murmurs, wetting her lips. “How did you get this one?”

His head angles toward her slightly, so that she catches the faint gleam of his eyes, like fire in deep, dark water.

“A wright, I think, though it’s hard to keep track,” there’s a hint of humor in his voice, but its faint and laden down with remembered pain and terror.

She drags her finger up to a puckered spot on his shoulder, wondering if she only imagines that he shivers beneath her touch. “And this one?”

He turns over fully then, startling her a bit as she retracts her hand, but he catches it in his, pressing it down into the bed between them. There is only a little space between them now, and her heart trembles slightly in her breast.

“An arrow,” he tells her, his eyes studying her in the dim light. There’s a story there, one that pains him, so she pushes no further.

His hair is unbound and the pretty curls fall across his forehead and eyes. She wonders absently what the strands might feel like, sliding between her fingers.  

“We’re hardly more than a patchwork of scars, aren’t we?” she asks, unable to hold his gaze for long, not this close, where her own wounds are laid bare. His fingers squeeze hers, rough with use, but warm and comforting all the same.

“We’re still here, and that’s all that really matters,” he tells her gruffly, firmly, and he’s right. They are here, here when so many others are not, and surely that is worth something.

 “Yes…” she replies after a long moment of comfortable, but strangely anticipatory silence. “Yes, I suppose  it is.”

They fall asleep like that, turned toward one another, hands clenched between them.

by feeltheforcebruh

tags: took me forever to post this
summary:
Why you ask?
Well here are 3 important things I think are extremely important in this scene and make a strong case for Political...
body:
This One Moment Completely Solidifies Political Jon For Me:

Why you ask?

Well here are 3 important things I think are extremely important in this scene and make a strong case for Political Jon.

1. Tyrion’s statement itself

2. The denial of Dany’s natural intuition

3. The implication that Tyrion’s statement is ridiculous

1. For my first point let me just make my opinion clear. There is No Reason for the show to sarcastically allude to Jon Snow having political motivations for his actions unless that’s actually the case!! None! I’ve wrapped my mind around it so many times trying to come up with a logical explanation for why the show writers would have Tyrion say this line and I can think of no other reason except for Political Jon.

To be honest if this moment wasn’t included in season 7 I would be less inclined to believe Political Jon and probably would have just believed that the acting and writing was subpar but thing is it was and that for me makes me do a double take. The line itself is random and it’s a weird way to assure someone that someone else has feelings for them. Especially in a season where they are trying to build up this “romance” and most of the general audience aren’t questioning the legitimacy of it. In short, it’s an out of place thing to say. The show writers could have easily had Tyrion say something along the lines of “he wouldn’t be staring at you longingly if he wasn’t in love with you” and the same point would have been made, but they took Tyrion’s line a step further and sarcastically joked that Jon’s intentions are political and to me that is suspect!

Also, has anyone noticed how in previous seasons many characters have said random things that are extremely specific and those things end up coming to pass?! 99% of the time the GA completely miss these lines or pass it off as something random and unimportant but these lines are the very things that happen in the next season of the show! I think this statement said by Tyrion falls under this same category. It’s to on the nose not too.

2. My second point is the most important point I want to bring up in this meta and I feel like it hasn’t been talked about yet. When Tyrion claims that Jon is in love with her, Dany’s IMMEDIATE reaction is to deny that Jon loves her because SHE CAN TELL that he’s not. Don’t get me wrong. I’m not saying that Dany doesn’t want Jon to be in love with her. At this point she is totally and completely into him, but what I’m saying is that Dany is aware that Jon doesn’t feel the same way. I don’t know what it is but as a woman you can just tell when a guy is into you. It’s like a sixth sense that’s been instilled in women from the beginning of time. You Just Know! I know a lot of people give Daenerys flack for being self absorbed but this isn’t her first rodeo and Dany has had enough experience to know when a guy is in love with her/ into her. Obviously her opinion on this changes later on in the season, but at this particular moment I think her God given woman intuition is kicking in here and in her gut she knows that Jon isn’t into her.

The main reason why I believe this is because of this previous scene:

I don’t know how people get this confused but the SOLE purpose of the beach scene was to display the feelings Jon and Daenerys have for each other. That’s it. For Daenerys it’s clear as day that she’s in love/falling in love with Jon Snow. As he departs Dragonstone, her eyes never leave him. As she watches him take off in his boat you best believe that she is praying on the inside that he turns back around to look at her. He’s heading off to danger and she might never see him again but if he turns around to look at her at least she can know that he might possibly have feelings for her too, but he doesn’t.

Instead Jorah, the guy who is desperately in love with her but she’s not that into, turns around and by the look of her face she is deeply disappointed. I 100% believe that this moment on the beach was the setup for why Daenerys denied that Jon was in love with her in her conversation with Tyrion. She witnessed it with her own eyes and clearly saw the difference in behavior between someone who’s in love with you and someone who isn’t. So when she denies what Tyrion says, I truly believe she is trusting her gut/instincts and she’s spot on!

The placement of these scenes weren’t done by accident and I believe this is what the show writers wanted us to pay attention too and connect. Another important point is this. Anytime dialogue leads to someone disregarding their initial gut instincts it always a red flag! If you look back and rewatch season 7, where in the show do you see Jon staring longingly at Daenerys? Better question, where do you see Tyrion witnessing Jon longingly staring at Daenerys? For both of those questions the answer is you don’t. There’s not a scene that depicts either of this in the show. You know what there is a scene of though? Tyrion witnessing Dany longingly stare after Jon. But he doesn’t bring that up in his conversation with her and tells her the opposite of what he saw. Maybe he assumed that because Dany has feels Jon has feels too but it’s clear that any in “love vibes” Tyrion got from Jon, Dany didn’t pick up on it at all.

Bonus: I think this scene is also one of many scenes used to set up the eventual complete break down of Tyrion and Dany’s relationship. The show keeps putting Tyrion in a position where he keeps on giving Dany advice/opinions that back fire. I can easily see Dany blaming Tyrion for leading her astray or making her believe Jon’s feelings were true when they weren’t.

3. Last but certainly not least I want to talk about how Tyrion’s statement is implied as ridiculous. I think the show writers also did this on purpose. As an audience, they want us to think that it’s ridiculous for Jon Snow to stare longingly at Daenerys for the sake of a successful military alliance when in actuality it’s not ridiculous at all. They want us to get caught up and focused on the “supposed romance” rather than the politics so that when the truth comes out we will be caught off guard.

At the moment Tyrion said this line in the show, Jon Still Hadn’t Secured A Successful Military Alliance with Dany! The one thing he had set out to do! In fact, if anything the wight hunt shows how unsuccessful he was in gaining her as an ally because he ended up going to extreme measures to convince both Dany and Cersei that the White Walkers are real. Considering that the fate of Westeros is at stake and the people who need to be on board still need convincing, It’s not unreasonable to think Jon might stare at Daenerys for political reasons but it’s unreasonable to think that he won’t. The show is clearly trying to misdirect us here. They want us to believe that at this point Jon and Dany are already allies but that’s simply not true and they also want us to forget the true purpose of why Jon came to Dragonstone in the first place which was to secure an alliance!

Am I crazy to get this much of this out of one scene?! Maybe. But when I broke things down, I truly believe this scene was more than a simple conversation and makes a strong case for Political Jon.

Especially in a season where they are trying to build up this “romance” and most of the general audience aren’t questioning the legitimacy of it. In short, it’s an out of place thing to say. The show writers could have easily had Tyrion say something along the lines of “he wouldn’t be staring at you longingly if he wasn’t in love with you” and the same point would have been made, but they took Tyrion’s line a step further and sarcastically joked that Jon’s intentions are political and to me that is suspect!

Also, has anyone noticed how in previous seasons many characters have said random things that are extremely specific and those things end up coming to pass?! 99% of the time the GA completely miss these lines or pass it off as something random and unimportant but these lines are the very things that happen in the next season of the show! I think this statement said by Tyrion falls under this same category. It’s to on the nose not too.

2. My second point is the most important point I want to bring up in this meta and I feel like it hasn’t been talked about yet. When Tyrion claims that Jon is in love with her, Dany’s IMMEDIATE reaction is to deny that Jon loves her because SHE CAN TELL that he’s not. Don’t get me wrong. I’m not saying that Dany doesn’t want Jon to be in love with her. At this point she is totally and completely into him, but what I’m saying is that Dany is aware that Jon doesn’t feel the same way. I don’t know what it is but as a woman you can just tell when a guy is into you. It’s like a sixth sense that’s been instilled in women from the beginning of time. You Just Know! I know a lot of people give Daenerys flack for being self absorbed but this isn’t her first rodeo and Dany has had enough experience to know when a guy is in love with her/ into her. Obviously her opinion on this changes later on in the season, but at this particular moment I think her God given woman intuition is kicking in here and in her gut she knows that Jon isn’t into her.

The main reason why I believe this is because of this previous scene:

I don’t know how people get this confused but the SOLE purpose of the beach scene was to display the feelings Jon and Daenerys have for each other. That’s it. For Daenerys it’s clear as day that she’s in love/falling in love with Jon Snow. As he departs Dragonstone, her eyes never leave him. As she watches him take off in his boat you best believe that she is praying on the inside that he turns back around to look at her. He’s heading off to danger and she might never see him again but if he turns around to look at her at least she can know that he might possibly have feelings for her too, but he doesn’t.

Instead Jorah, the guy who is desperately in love with her but she’s not that into, turns around and by the look of her face she is deeply disappointed. I 100% believe that this moment on the beach was the setup for why Daenerys denied that Jon was in love with her in her conversation with Tyrion. She witnessed it with her own eyes and clearly saw the difference in behavior between someone who’s in love with you and someone who isn’t. So when she denies what Tyrion says, I truly believe she is trusting her gut/instincts and she’s spot on!

The placement of these scenes weren’t done by accident and I believe this is what the show writers wanted us to pay attention too and connect. Another important point is this. Anytime dialogue leads to someone disregarding their initial gut instincts it always a red flag! If you look back and rewatch season 7, where in the show do you see Jon staring longingly at Daenerys? Better question, where do you see Tyrion witnessing Jon longingly staring at Daenerys? For both of those questions the answer is you don’t. There’s not a scene that depicts either of this in the show. You know what there is a scene of though? Tyrion witnessing Dany longingly stare after Jon. But he doesn’t bring that up in his conversation with her and tells her the opposite of what he saw. Maybe he assumed that because Dany has feels Jon has feels too but it’s clear that any in “love vibes” Tyrion got from Jon, Dany didn’t pick up on it at all.

Bonus: I think this scene is also one of many scenes used to set up the eventual complete break down of Tyrion and Dany’s relationship. The show keeps putting Tyrion in a position where he keeps on giving Dany advice/opinions that back fire. I can easily see Dany blaming Tyrion for leading her astray or making her believe Jon’s feelings were true when they weren’t.

3. Last but certainly not least I want to talk about how Tyrion’s statement is implied as ridiculous. I think the show writers also did this on purpose. As an audience, they want us to think that it’s ridiculous for Jon Snow to stare longingly at Daenerys for the sake of a successful military alliance when in actuality it’s not ridiculous at all. They want us to get caught up and focused on the “supposed romance” rather than the politics so that when the truth comes out we will be caught off guard.

At the moment Tyrion said this line in the show, Jon Still Hadn’t Secured A Successful Military Alliance with Dany! The one thing he had set out to do! In fact, if anything the wight hunt shows how unsuccessful he was in gaining her as an ally because he ended up going to extreme measures to convince both Dany and Cersei that the White Walkers are real. Considering that the fate of Westeros is at stake and the people who need to be on board still need convincing, It’s not unreasonable to think Jon might stare at Daenerys for political reasons but it’s unreasonable to think that he won’t. The show is clearly trying to misdirect us here. They want us to believe that at this point Jon and Dany are already allies but that’s simply not true and they also want us to forget the true purpose of why Jon came to Dragonstone in the first place which was to secure an alliance!

Am I crazy to get this much of this out of one scene?! Maybe. But when I broke things down, I truly believe this scene was more than a simple conversation and makes a strong case for Political Jon.
trail.content:
This One Moment Completely Solidifies Political Jon For Me:

Why you ask?

Well here are 3 important things I think are extremely important in this scene and make a strong case for Political Jon.

1. Tyrion’s statement itself

2. The denial of Dany’s natural intuition

3. The implication that Tyrion’s statement is ridiculous

1. For my first point let me just make my opinion clear. There is No Reason for the show to sarcastically allude to Jon Snow having political motivations for his actions unless that’s actually the case!! None! I’ve wrapped my mind around it so many times trying to come up with a logical explanation for why the show writers would have Tyrion say this line and I can think of no other reason except for Political Jon.

To be honest if this moment wasn’t included in season 7 I would be less inclined to believe Political Jon and probably would have just believed that the acting and writing was subpar but thing is it was and that for me makes me do a double take. The line itself is random and it’s a weird way to assure someone that someone else has feelings for them. Especially in a season where they are trying to build up this “romance” and most of the general audience aren’t questioning the legitimacy of it. In short, it’s an out of place thing to say. The show writers could have easily had Tyrion say something along the lines of “he wouldn’t be staring at you longingly if he wasn’t in love with you” and the same point would have been made, but they took Tyrion’s line a step further and sarcastically joked that Jon’s intentions are political and to me that is suspect!

Also, has anyone noticed how in previous seasons many characters have said random things that are extremely specific and those things end up coming to pass?! 99% of the time the GA completely miss these lines or pass it off as something random and unimportant but these lines are the very things that happen in the next season of the show! I think this statement said by Tyrion falls under this same category. It’s to on the nose not too.

Obviously her opinion on this changes later on in the season, but at this particular moment I think her God given woman intuition is kicking in here and in her gut she knows that Jon isn’t into her.

The main reason why I believe this is because of this previous scene:

I don’t know how people get this confused but the SOLE purpose of the beach scene was to display the feelings Jon and Daenerys have for each other. That’s it. For Daenerys it’s clear as day that she’s in love/falling in love with Jon Snow. As he departs Dragonstone, her eyes never leave him. As she watches him take off in his boat you best believe that she is praying on the inside that he turns back around to look at her. He’s heading off to danger and she might never see him again but if he turns around to look at her at least she can know that he might possibly have feelings for her too, but he doesn’t.

She witnessed it with her own eyes and clearly saw the difference in behavior between someone who’s in love with you and someone who isn’t. The placement of these scenes weren’t done by accident and I believe this is what the show writers wanted us to pay attention too and connect. Another important point is this. Anytime dialogue leads to someone disregarding their initial gut instincts it always a red flag! If you look back and rewatch season 7, where in the show do you see Jon staring longingly at Daenerys? Better question, where do you see Tyrion witnessing Jon longingly staring at Daenerys? For both of those questions the answer is you don’t. There’s not a scene that depicts either of this in the show. You know what there is a scene of though? Tyrion witnessing Dany longingly stare after Jon. But he doesn’t bring that up in his conversation with her and tells her the opposite of what he saw. Maybe he assumed that because Dany has feels Jon has feels too but it’s clear that any in “love vibes” Tyrion got from Jon, Dany didn’t pick up on it at all.

Bonus: I think this scene is also one of many scenes used to set up the eventual complete break down of Tyrion and Dany’s relationship. The show keeps putting Tyrion in a position where he keeps on giving Dany advice/opinions that back fire. I can easily see Dany blaming Tyrion for leading her astray or making her believe Jon’s feelings were true when they weren’t.

3. Last but certainly not least I want to talk about how Tyrion’s statement is implied as ridiculous. I think the show writers also did this on purpose. As an audience, they want us to think that it’s ridiculous for Jon Snow to stare longingly at Daenerys for the sake of a successful military alliance when in actuality it’s not ridiculous at all. They want us to get caught up and focused on the “supposed romance” rather than the politics so that when the truth comes out we will be caught off guard.

At the moment Tyrion said this line in the show, Jon Still Hadn’t Secured A Successful Military Alliance with Dany! The one thing he had set out to do! In fact, if anything the wight hunt shows how unsuccessful he was in gaining her as an ally because he ended up going to extreme measures to convince both Dany and Cersei that the White Walkers are real. Considering that the fate of Westeros is at stake and the people who need to be on board still need convincing, It’s not unreasonable to think Jon might stare at Daenerys for political reasons but it’s unreasonable to think that he won’t. The show is clearly trying to misdirect us here. summary: ❤️ In book Jon is a heir of North. Robb Stark named him his father’s name. In his Statement Jon Snow is his heir . Robb Stark...
body:
❤️ In book Jon is a heir of North. Robb Stark named him his father’s name. In his Statement Jon Snow is his heir . Robb Stark was last King in The North

❤️Catelyn Stark the Lady of Winterfell confirmed his son’s statement

❤️In Show Jon is The king in the north. King who people choice. This is the greatest parallel between book and show

❤️ Sansa was sitting there when people choice Jon. But Lords choice Jon not Sansa.

❤️probably Jon isn’t son of Ned Stark but his official mother is Lady of Winterfell Lyanna Stark and crown prince Rhaegar Targaryen. And Jon is male.

question: Imagine elderly Dany + Jon assuring each other they are still just as beautiful as they were when they were young while surrounded by their grandchildren.

summary: I did not make the rules by BMike22 “Why aren’t you down in the yard?” Arya asked him.  He gave her a half smile. “Bastards are...
caption:
I did not make the rules by BMike22

“Why aren’t you down in the yard?” Arya asked him.

He gave her a half smile. “Bastards are not allowed to damage young princes,” he said. “Any bruises they take in the practice yard must come from trueborn swords.”

“Oh.” Arya felt abashed. She should have realized. For the second time today, Arya reflected that life was not fair.

She watched her little brother whack at Tommen. “I could do just as good as Bran,” she said. “He’s only seven. I’m nine.”

Jon looked her over with all his fourteen-year-old wisdom. “You’re too skinny,” he said. He took her arm to feel her muscle. Then he sighed and shook his head. “I doubt you could even lift a longsword, little sister, never mind swing one.”

Arya snatched back her arm and glared at him. Jon messed up her hair again. They watched Bran and Tommen circle each other.

“You see Prince Joffrey?” Jon asked.

She hadn’t, not at first glance, but when she looked again she found him to the back, under the shade of the high stone wall. He was surrounded by men she did not recognize, young squires in the livery of Lannister and Baratheon, strangers all. There were a few older men among them; knights, she surmised.

“Look at the arms on his surcoat,” Jon suggested.

Arya looked. An ornate shield had been embroidered on the prince’s padded surcoat. No doubt the needlework was exquisite. The arms were divided down the middle; on one side was the crowned stag of the royal House, on the other the lion of Lannister.

“The Lannisters are proud,” Jon observed. “You’d think the royal sigil would be sufficient, but no. He makes his mother’s House equal in honor to the king’s.”

“The woman is important too!” Arya protested.

Jon chuckled. “Perhaps you should do the same thing, little sister. Wed Tully to Stark in your arms.”

“A wolf with a fish in its mouth?” It made her laugh. “That would look silly. Besides, if a girl can’t fight, why should she have a coat of arms?”

Jon shrugged. “Girls get the arms but not the swords. Bastards get the swords but not the arms. I did not make the rules, little sister.” - AGoT Arya I

tags: i should tag the ship in question but i wont im not THAT much of an asshole
summary: Sansa to Theon: “They were your brothers”
body:
Sansa to Theon: “They were your brothers”

She considers Theon to have been a brother to Bran and Rickon. She tells him as much. This matches up to what Theon is called in the North in ADwD: Theon Kinslayer. Kinslayer, even though he shares no blood with the Starks.

So explain to me, those of you who write the metas with thousands of words, how the North will be fine with Jon and Sansa marrying (and I’m gonna operate under the assumption it’s something they both want, which is absurd but nonetheless here we are, and not forced on them) when they consider Theon a brother to the Starks, EVEN THOUGH HES NOT. So how can they consider Jon anything but Sansa’s sister as well? How would the Northern Lords be fine with this shit?

They wouldn’t. They profoundly wouldn’t. They’d consider it incest. They’d want no part of it.

She considers Theon to have been a brother to Bran and Rickon. She tells him as much. This matches up to what Theon is called in the North in ADwD: Theon Kinslayer. Kinslayer, even though he shares no blood with the Starks.

So explain to me, those of you who write the metas with thousands of words, how the North will be fine with Jon and Sansa marrying (and I’m gonna operate under the assumption it’s something they both want, which is absurd but nonetheless here we are, and not forced on them) when they consider Theon a brother to the Starks, EVEN THOUGH HES NOT. So how can they consider Jon anything but Sansa’s sister as well? How would the Northern Lords be fine with this shit?

They wouldn’t. They profoundly wouldn’t. They’d consider it incest. They’d want no part of it.
trail.content:
Sansa to Theon: “They were your brothers”

She considers Theon to have been a brother to Bran and Rickon. She tells him as much. This matches up to what Theon is called in the North in ADwD: Theon Kinslayer. Kinslayer, even though he shares no blood with the Starks.

So explain to me, those of you who write the metas with thousands of words, how the North will be fine with Jon and Sansa marrying (and I’m gonna operate under the assumption it’s something they both want, which is absurd but nonetheless here we are, and not forced on them) when they consider Theon a brother to the Starks, EVEN THOUGH HES NOT. So how can they consider Jon anything but Sansa’s sister as well? How would the Northern Lords be fine with this shit?

They wouldn’t. They profoundly wouldn’t. They’d consider it incest. They’d want no part of it.

summary: After tomorrow I'm gonna have to move to Cersei on my Game of Thrones calendar...  It sucks cuz this month is Jon after what...
body: After tomorrow I’m gonna have to move to Cersei on my Game of Thrones calendar… It sucks cuz this month is Jon after what felt like forever with the “holy” Margaery look last month! I don’t wanna swap Jon for Cersei!
